@StartsWithABang "@RichardAJowsey @thephysicsmill @GeorgeShiber The point is that
column2: in standard cosmology
column3: z is from expanding space
column4: not from speeding gal's." "Mon Feb 22 00:15:50 +0000 2016" True

column1: @StartsWithABang "@RichardAJowsey @thephysicsmill @GeorgeShiber I do; we have observations that show how z and T go together; they don't if z is Doppler." "Sun Feb 21 23:23:31 +0000 2016" True
@StartsWithABang "@RichardAJowsey @thephysicsmill @GeorgeShiber No. Doppler shift is a low-speed approximation that is valid
column2: but breaks down at high-z." "Sun Feb 21 23:22:27 +0000 2016" True

column1: @StartsWithABang "@RichardAJowsey @thephysicsmill @GeorgeShiber Z interpretation is not doppler. Has to be gravitational
column2: resulting in high-T at high-z." "Sun Feb 21 23:14:47 +0000 2016" True
